position.marginalia_text: Two chairs on below [the] long trap

substitution.copyText: He took my father grossly, full of bread, | With all his crimes broad blown as flush as May, | And how his audit stands who knows save heaven? | But in our circumstance and course of thought, | 'Tis heavy with him: and am I then reveng'd | To take him in the purging of his soul
substitution.amendedText: He took my father grossly, full of bread, | With all his crimes broad blown, as flush as May, | And how his audit stands, who knows save heaven! | But in our circumstance and course of thought, | 'Tis heavy with him; and am I then reveng'd, | To take him in the purging of his soul

substitution.copyText: Or in th'incestuous pleasures of his bed, | At game, a swearing, or about some act | That hath no rellish of salvation in't, | " Then trip him that his heels may kick at heaven, | " And that his soul may be as damn'd and black | " As hell whereto it goes: " my mother stays, | This Physick but prolongs thy sickly days.
substitution.amendedText: Or in th'incestuous pleasures of his bed, | or about some act | That hath no rellish of salvation in't, | my mother stays, | This Physick but prolongs thy sickly days.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Now mother, what's the matter?
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Now, mother, what's the matter?

substitution.copyText: Ham. Mother you have my father much offended.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Mother, you have my father much offended.

substitution.copyText: And would it were not so, you are my mother.
substitution.amendedText: And would you were not so-you are my mother.

substitution.copyText: Ham. Come, come, and sit down, you shall not budge, | You go not till I set you up a glass | Where you may see the utmost part of you.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Come, come, and sit you down, | You go not, till I set you up a glass | Where you may see the inmost part of you.
